entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
entry.content:
Hi Wes,

    Could you try to run the bindings through another Java VM, to see if the error reproduce?
    I'm also thinking about possible interaction problem between libgcrypt secure memory and Java.

    Note: please try to attach a git patch against the current master branche, this will make it
    much easy for developers to apply your code.

    Thanks!

entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
entry.content:
• File bindings-java.tar.gz added

Here's another go at it:

Apparently there is a bug in SWIG similar to:

http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1388343&group_id=1645&atid=301645

Where init() isn't properly handled in java so, we had to expose init manually in c++/include/prelude.hxx (see bindings/java/prelude.hxx.patch)

once that was done, things compiled OK and bindings/java/testapp/test.java worked, as long as you call:

com.prelude.easy.PreludeEasy.prelude_init();

in your java code (Start() alone doesn't seem to cut it)

It's still a bit rough, but it appears to work from my dev box. I dunno if you're a bit more familiar with SWIG than I am and can send a patch up-stream to them.

entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
entry.content:
Hello Wes!

    Thanks for investigating the issue, this is great work. I recall seeing similar SWIG behavior on others Libprelude bindings, and I will have to have a look at this to see if there is a possible workaround that we can envisage.

    In order for me to be able to work on your code, I need you to provide me with a git generated patch. Here are the step on how to produce one:

    git clone git://git.prelude-ids.com/libprelude
cd libprelude

[apply your modification to the tree now]

Run "git add" for each files you added and modified, (not on autogenerated files).
git commit
git format-patch origin/master

[Attach the resulting patch here]

    Thanks!

entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
entry.content:
• File patch1.txt View added
  • File patch2.txt View added

so a bit of a git newbie, but here's a stab at it.

entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
entry.content:
• File patch3.txt View added

forgot the patch that exposes init() in c++/include/prelude.hxx (the work-around for swig)

entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
entry.content:
Hello Wes, thanks for the update!

    Unfortunately, the patch seems to be malformed, and I'm unable to apply it.

    In order to generate the patch, could you use the '''git format-patch''' command, as you did for #363? This should generate a proper patch, and you will additionally get a ChangeLog entry with your own credits in the top header when the patch is applied.

    Regards,

entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
entry.content:
• File 0001-imported-initial-files-for-java-bindings.patch View added
  • File 0002-make-files-don-t-like-spaces.patch View added
  • File 0003-added-placeholder-that-swig-java-needs-for-output.patch View added

lets try this again:

you might need to apply these in succession; i started learning how to do the git branch thing and had to fix things along the way; but they should work (and it does build fwiw).

entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
entry.content:
Hello Wes, thanks for the fixed patch!

    Here are a few comments/question :

    - A test for the presence of Java headers (namely jni.h) should be added to configure.in
    - Is Ant an absolute requirement to build the generated jar files, or is it possible to use more standard java tools ?
    - Could you report the %init issue on the SWIG bug tracking system ? Maybe they'll come with a workaround for this issue

    Regards,

entry.title: Libprelude - Feature #362: java bindings
